column2: Odd Shape Out (December 2015) - National Council of Teachers of Mathematics
column3: Consider the four quadrilaterals shown below. Which shape is the odd shape out? In other words, find and describe a property that three of the shapes have but the fourth shape does not.

column2: Odd Shape Out (December 2015) - National Council of Teachers of Mathematics
column3: Extension: Find and describe a way that each of the four shapes could be the odd shape out.
